alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:51AM CDT until June 14 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL...SOUTHWESTERN MADISON...SOUTHEASTERN LIMESTONE AND NORTHEASTERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 1051 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Priceville, or 8 miles northeast of Hartselle, moving east at 45 mph. At 1047 AM media reported dime size hail with this storm. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville, Decatur, Madison, Hartselle, Redstone Arsenal, Priceville, Owens Cross Roads, Gurley, Triana and Marshall Space Flight Center. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
